MultiRegVariablesMix 0.1.0
  • Reference

Preprocessor Class

Source: R/Preprocessor.R
Preprocessor.Rd

A class for preprocessing data, including handling mixed types (categorical and numerical), scaling, and encoding (label encoding, one-hot encoding, or AFDM for dimensionality reduction).

Public fields

categorical_cols

Names of categorical columns in the dataset.

numerical_cols

Names of numerical columns in the dataset.

label_mappings

A list of mappings for label encoding of categorical variables.

one_hot_columns

A list of column names generated during one-hot encoding.

scaling_params

Parameters (mean, sd) for scaling numerical variables.

afdm_model

The AFDM model object for dimensionality reduction.

encoding_type

Encoding type: "label", "one-hot", or "afdm".

Methods

Public methods

  • Preprocessor$new()

  • Preprocessor$identify_columns()

  • Preprocessor$scale_data()

  • Preprocessor$encode_label()

  • Preprocessor$encode_one_hot()

  • Preprocessor$explore_famd()

  • Preprocessor$encode_afdm()

  • Preprocessor$preprocess()

  • Preprocessor$clone()

Method new()

Initialize the preprocessor with the chosen encoding type.

Usage

Preprocessor$new(encoding_type = c("label", "one-hot", "afdm"))

Arguments

encoding_type

The type of encoding to apply: "label", "one-hot", or "afdm".

Method identify_columns()

Identify categorical and numerical columns in a dataset.

Usage

Preprocessor$identify_columns(data)

Arguments

data

A data frame.

Method scale_data()

Scale numerical data to have zero mean and unit variance.

Usage

Preprocessor$scale_data(data, is_training = TRUE)

Arguments

data

A data frame.

is_training

A boolean indicating if this is the training dataset.

Returns

The scaled dataset.

Method encode_label()

Apply label encoding to categorical variables.

Usage

Preprocessor$encode_label(data, is_training = TRUE)

Arguments

data

A data frame.

is_training

A boolean indicating if this is the training dataset.

Returns

The label-encoded dataset.

Method encode_one_hot()

Apply one-hot encoding to categorical variables.

Usage

Preprocessor$encode_one_hot(data, is_training = TRUE)

Arguments

data

A data frame.

is_training

A boolean indicating if this is the training dataset.

Returns

The one-hot encoded dataset as a matrix.

Method explore_famd()

Explore variances explained by dimensions in AFDM.

Usage

Preprocessor$explore_famd(X)

Arguments

X

A dataset.

Returns

Variances explained by each dimension.

Method encode_afdm()

Apply AFDM encoding for dimensionality reduction.

Usage

Preprocessor$encode_afdm(data, is_training = TRUE, ncp = NULL)

Arguments

data

A data frame.

is_training

A boolean indicating if this is the training dataset.

ncp

The number of principal components to retain.

Returns

The dataset projected into the AFDM space.

Method preprocess()

Preprocess the dataset by scaling and encoding.

Usage

Preprocessor$preprocess(data, is_training = TRUE, ncp = NULL)

Arguments

data

A data frame.

is_training

A boolean indicating if this is the training dataset.

ncp

The number of principal components to retain for AFDM.

Returns

The preprocessed dataset.

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

Preprocessor$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.
